Rulings.Cat:
● Typically, Player A will Normal Summon “D.D. Guide”, and control of “D.D. Guide” will shift to Player B. During each End Phase, Player B will activate the effect of their “D.D. Guide”, Player A will select 1 card in Player B’s GY, and Player B will remove that card from play.
● If Player A uses “Snatch Steal” to take control of the “D.D. Guide” they Normal Summoned, then they will be the one to lose a card from the GY each End Phase. 
● Both effects of “D.D. Guide” are Trigger Effects that can be chained to.
● The effect of “D.D. Guide” targets 1 card in the GY. The target is chosen by the controller’s opponent.
● If you Normal Summon “D.D. Guide” and your opponent’s Monster Card Zones are full, “D.D. Guide” will be destroyed when its effect resolves.
● If “Kycoo the Ghost Destroyer” and “D.D. Guide” are on opposite sides of the field, the effect of “D.D. Guide” will activate but not resolve.

Rulings.Base:
1. Typically, Player A will Normal Summon "D.D. Guide", and control of "D.D. Guide" will shift to Player B. During each End Phase, Player B will activate the effect of their "D.D. Guide", Player A will select 1 card in Player B's GY, and Player B will remove that card from play.
2. If Player A uses "Snatch Steal" to take control of the "D.D. Guide" they Normal Summoned, then they will be the one to lose a card from the GY each End Phase.
3. Both effects of "D.D. Guide" are Trigger Effects that can be chained to.
4. The effect of "D.D. Guide" targets 1 card in the GY. The target is chosen by the controller's opponent.
5. If you Normal Summon "D.D. Guide" and your opponent's Monster Card Zones are full, "D.D. Guide" will be destroyed when its effect resolves.
6. If "Kycoo the Ghost Destroyer" and "D.D. Guide" are on opposite sides of the field, the effect of "D.D. Guide" will activate but not resolve.
